attributes.action: Make MPs Spend A Day In An Infant School Class To Learn How To Behave & Listen
attributes.additional_details: By making every MP, new and old, spend at least a day in an infant school class, they would soon learn how to behave properly when it’s clear to me that most 4-6 year olds know how to behave properly with a little guidance and support.
attributes.background: The British public are growing tired of watching session after session in the House of Commons just descend into shouting, abuse, and generally the sort of behaviour that you wouldn’t expect in an infant school class. How is this democracy?

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about whether and when to visits schools are a matter for individual MPs, not the UK Government or Parliament.
